text: according to Catholic Church teaching
marriage is forever those who are
divorced can only remarry outside the
church and they're then not allowed to
receive Holy Communion unless the
marriage is annulled that is declared
invalid that requires proof that there
was a lack of free will psychological
maturity or openness to having children
from the start but getting a decree of
nullity is slow and expensive a local
diocese can make the decision but it
must then be reviewed by a tribunal
contested cases go to the Vatican appeal
court for a ruling a year ago the Pope
asked Church lawyers to look at making
the process simpler and quicker it's
unlikely that the church will change its
teaching on divorce but it's likely to
become easier for estranged couples to
prove their marriage was invalid
allowing them to remarry and still
participate fully within church life Ben
land BBC News
